definition: to conflict with (an idea or opinion etc)/to depart from (established norms or standards etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
to not fit one's perception of sth (idiom)

sentences.english: God will never guide us contrary to his Word.
sentences.chinese: 神的带领，绝不会与祂的话语相违。

sentences.english: This is our natural condition and yet most contrary to our inclination ;
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们所处的与我们意愿完全相违的自然状况。

sentences.english: They should not conflict with common mental associations .
sentences.chinese: 他们不应与人们感官上共同的联想相违。

sentences.english: Because that would be to ignore the strong feelings people have toward their faith.
sentences.chinese: 因为合法离婚和人民心中强烈的宗教信仰是相违悖的。

definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
to go against/to be contrary to/perverse/rebellious
to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
to transgress/to violate (the rules)/same as 違背|违背
to not conform to/to be unsuited to/to be out of keeping with/should not/ought out
unrealistic argument/high flown and impractical opinion
